intro: Guajava oerstediana, commonly known as the Oersted's guajava, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
